titles.title: Firearm Theft Prevention Act of 2004
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for a nonrefundable tax credit against income tax for individuals who purchase a residential gun safe for the safe storage of firearms.
Firearm Theft Prevention Act of 2004

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Firearm Theft Prevention Act of 2004 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a nonrefundable tax credit for up to 25 percent of the cost of a safe in a residence for the storage of firearms which includes a secure locking mechanism and is designed to prevent unauthorized access by children under the age of 18. Limits the amount of such credit to $250.
